title: Drawing, Design for  Mahogany Serving Table on Fluted Legs, 1900–05
title_raw: Design for  Mahogany Serving Table on Fluted Legs
markings: Partial watermark across verso bottom : ORIENTAL LINEN
inscribed: In graphite, at lower right: "SERVING TABLE/ of Mahogany"; in graphite, lower center: "3'-6" long"; in graphite, to right of  design (the right drawer): "small front"
creditline: Gift of The Lake St. Louis Historical Society
description: Rectangular top with two-drawer unit and backsplash resting on four straight, yet tapered, fluted legs terminating in pear-shaped feet.  Lower shelf attaches midway above floor level.

participants.person_name: The Lake St. Louis Historical Society

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, Design for  Mahogany Serving Table on Fluted Legs, 1900–05. Graphite on thin, cream paper. 
Gift of The Lake St. Louis Historical Society. 2000-69-92
